author: damianon
body:
We have a script that runs just fine on Powershell 5, but when executing on devops agenst running ubuntu and powershell core 7.1 it always fails with a 401 Error.

```
$Password = ConvertTo-SecureString $MongoAtlasApiKeyPrivate -AsPlainText -Force
$Credentials = New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential ($MongoAtlasApiKeyPublic, $Password)

Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $MongoAtlasApiUrl -Method POST -ContentType "application/json" -Credential $Credentials -Body $json
```

It's trying to callt he mongo atlas api, which according to mongo's documentation requires digest authentictaion. However I couldn't find anything mentioning digest with Invoke-WebRequest. Onlny Oauth and other auth methods, but nothing about digest. Is it just no possible anymore since PWSH 6/7?

This is the corresponding mongo documentation: https://docs.atlas.mongodb.com/reference/api/whitelist-add-one

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
I believe it is not PowerShell issue but underlying .Net. See https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/42301
You can discuss this there.

As workaround you always add an authentication header manually - you can find examples in Internet.

comments.author: damianon
comments.body:
Thanks for that link.

I can find many examples for basic or bearer authentication, but almost nothing about digest with powershell.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @damianon The repo is only for PowerShell developers. You can get help faster on forums and other resources.

comments.author: tik9
comments.body: I found an example for `digest` authentication [here](https://www.msxfaq.de/tools/prtg/getfritzmactable.htm#das_skript). It is in german, you see in the `.ps1` that the parameter `-credential` is used with `Invoke-RestMethod`. I think this is digest, as in the "Wireshark" part of the linked website you see the use of digest: `www-authenticate: digest`. I think that `curl` can be used with any method with the parameter `--anyauth` and has `--digest` as param as well. [Here](https://superuser.com/a/1574321/411849) is more on digest.

title: Invoke-WebRequest with digest
